Title.evidence: Arthroscopic Partial Meniscectomy and Physical Therapy in Degenerative Meniscal Tear: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to APM with PT or PT alone.

Participants.evidence: included subjects aged ≥45 years with mild-to-moderate osteoarthritis and degenerative meniscal tear.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to APM with PT or PT alone.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to identify factors associated with crossover to APM and compare pain relief between crossover patients and those initially randomized to APM.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain relief at 6 months, measured by the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) Pain Score.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 341 subjects were randomised: 164 to APM and 177 to PT.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of those in the PT group, 48 (27%) crossed over to APM within 140 days.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 6 months, 81% of crossover patients and 82% of APM patients had ≥10-point pain improvement, compared to 73% in the PT group.
